oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Lynchburg Historic District: Womble House front angle
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Color photograph of Womble House, circa 1915, on Majors Street. One story gable-front and wing with wraparound porch has a concrete foundation, weatherboard siding, and metal roof. A central brick chimney is located in the west wing, and a brick exterior end chimney is located at the gable end of the north wing.

The Lynchburg Historic District is comprised of eighty-two properties which make up the central part of the community, located in Moore County, TN. Lynchburg was designated as the county seat of the newly established Moore County in 1871. It is also the commercial and industrial center for the county. The area contains buildings that represent the development of Lynchburg from a crossroads community into the political and commercial center of Moore County. The integrity of the district is evident not only in the historic buildings, but in the layout of the town, which reflects the impact of the county seat designation. The focus of the historic district is a downtown core which surrounds the courthouse block and is known as the Public Square.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Historic buildings; Historic districts; Lynchburg (Tenn.)
